text: - It's Christmas!
- In New York City!
(upbeat sleigh bell music)

- [Deb] No city on Earth does
Christmas quite like New York.

If you plan on making
your way to the Big Apple
during the holidays,

here are some not-to-miss
activities and attractions
to help you plan your trip.
So lace up your skates, zip up your parka,
and let's explore Christmas in New York.
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)
Be sure to watch our Best of New York vlog
for other great things to do in the city,
where we highlight popular attractions
and other great things to see and do.
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)

[Dave] - We're here at the famous
Radio City Music Hall,

taking in the Rockettes
Christmas Extravaganza.
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)
- The Rockettes are about to begin!
It's Christmas in New York!
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)

Radio City Music Hall's
Christmas Spectacular

is a New York institution
dating back to 1933.

This was our favorite thing to
do in Christmas in New York,

with the stage being turned
into a winter wonderland
as the Rockettes' precision timing
entertained us for 90 minutes.
It's a fun event for the whole family.

While you plan your Radio
City Music Hall stop,
make sure to book a backstage tour
to see it from behind the scenes.
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)
We are going on a tour behind the scenes
of Radio City Music Hall.
I've got my pass, I'm a VIP.
The backstage pass is fascinating

to see how the stage is
operated with giant hydraulics.
This feat of engineering is incredible,

housing the intricate
shows of the Rockettes,

to Broadway productions,
and even sporting events.

My favorite was seeing
the Rockefeller Apartment,
where movie icons like Judy Garland
and Walt Disney relaxed,

and we had the chance
to even meet a Rockette
and see their rehearsal space.
(upbeat sleigh bell music continues)
I love New York!
(jazzy sleigh bell music)

Don't forget to come
to Rockefeller Center.
- It's good in both the winter and summer.
- You cannot visit New York at Christmas

and not see the
Rockefeller Christmas tree.

The Rockefeller Center
is decorated to the nines
with Christmas decorations.

And one of the bucket-list
things to do in New York

in December, is to go skating
in the Rockefeller rink.
(jazzy sleigh bell music continues)
While you're at the Rockefeller Center,
go up to the top of the Rock
for a bird's eye view of New York City.
Another great viewpoint here in New York
is going to the top of the Rock.
And not only is it a great viewpoint,
it's a really cool destination
because it is home to NBC Studios.

You've got a great view of
the Empire State Building,

it has a bunch of different
platforms that you can look out

And then, you can pop by
and maybe see Jimmy Fallon
of "The Tonight Show."
(jazzy sleigh bell music continues)
- So we're here in New York City,
walking along the famous Fifth Avenue,
checking out the Christmas displays.
(jazzy sleigh bell music continues)
- [Deb] The Sachs Fifth Avenue light show

runs every 10 minutes
during the holiday season.

If you stand at the viewpoint
of the Warner Brothers tree
at the Rockefeller Center,
just do a 180-degree turn from the rink,
and you'll see the display.
(jazzy sleigh bell music continues)

The five-minute show is
choreographed to music,

and it's one of the great
things to do for free
in New York at Christmas.
(jazzy piano interlude)

- Fulfill your dream of
playing the big piano,
here at FAO Schwarz.

FAO Schwarz is the oldest
toy store in America,

and it has reopened at
the Rockefeller Center,
with the big piano,

made famous by Tom
Hanks in "Big," to boot.
No New York Christmas is complete
without popping in to see it,
and taking your turn at the piano keys.
(jazzy sleigh bell music continues)
(bright enchanting music)

- [Deb] Nothing rings
in the holiday season
quite like "The Nutcracker."

The New York City Ballet
performs this holiday classic
every year at the Lincoln Center.
The Lincoln Center also houses
the opera house and Geffen Hall,

where the New York City
Philharmonic plays.
Make sure to book a ticket

at one of these classic event
spaces while in New York.
(bright enchanting music continues)
- Come to Hershey's for a hot chocolate,
or, just chocolate.
No trip to New York would be complete
without visiting Times Square.
And when visiting at Christmas,
pop into the Hershey's store,
where you can grab a hot chocolate
or do some holiday shopping.
(bright enchanting music continues)
- Come skating at Bryant Park.
Admission is free.

Bryant Park is the place
to be for the holidays.
Not only is there outdoor skating,

there is a Christmas
market, shops and dining,

and they even have their
own Christmas tree.

- So there's Christmas markets
all over New York City,

and a fun thing to do,
is to visit them all.
They are open day or night,
and scattered throughout town,

including Bryant Park, Union
Square, Columbus Circle,
and even at Grand Central Station.
They're a fantastic place to go shopping
and get into the holiday spirit.
(cheerful sleigh bell music)
Don't miss taking a stroll through them,

where you can pick up
your holiday shopping,
sip on a hot cider,

and feel the vibe of
New York at Christmas.
(cheerful sleigh bell music continues)
- Come to Grand Central Station,
and they have a Christmas market here.
(cheerful sleigh bell music continues)
The Holiday Fair at Grand Central Terminal

is an indoor market that
runs until Christmas Eve.

Chances are you'll be
visiting Grand Central anyway,
so check out some of its dining, shopping,
and don't miss trying out the acoustics
in the Whispering Gallery.
(jazzy piano music)

The Macy's window displays
are a New York institution.
Make your way to Herald Square
to see the adorable decorations,

and go inside to finish up
your Christmas shopping.
(cheerful sleigh bell music continues)

And when in New York, be sure
to go Bloomingdale's as well.
They also get into the Christmas spirit
with very elegant displays inside.
(cheerful sleigh bell music continues)

Well, Central Park is huge.
(birds chirping)
We've just been walking around.
It's really beautiful,
but we don't know where we are,
and we don't know how to get out.
If you want to waste a good amount of time

on a good afternoon of
just walking in nature,
this is the place to go.
- (chuckles) Grand Central Park.
(Deb laughs)
(light whimsical music)

- Many a holiday movie was
filmed in Central Park.
And at Christmas, people love to visit it
to take carriage rides, go ice skating,
ride the carousel, or drink hot chocolate
at Tavern on the Green.
(light whimsical music continues)
What we enjoyed was simply strolling in
and taking in all of the iconic scenes.
(light whimsical music continues)
(lively sleigh bell music)
Something I highly recommend doing

is going to the Empire
State Building at night.

New York City really comes
alive with the city lights,
and it's the best time to go up.
Also, the crowds are really light.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)
If you love reliving holiday favorites,
go to the top of the Empire State Building
for views of New York lit up at Christmas,

and reenact your best
holiday classic scene.

We went up late at night
to avoid the crowds,
and it was fantastic.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)
The Vessel at Hudson Yards
is a not-to-miss attraction in New York.
And when the holiday season begins,

Wells Fargo lights up
the shops at Hudson Yards

with two million white
lights illuminating the area.

So, do some holiday shopping,
grab a hot chocolate,

and take a holiday stroll
along the High Line.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)

- Come on out to shoot the
iconic Manhattan skyline.

- [Deb] And, finally, make
your way over to Brooklyn
for the best views of Manhattan.

The neighborhood of Dumbo
houses Jane's Carousel,
the famous view of the Manhattan Bridge
from Washington Street,
and plenty of shops, restaurants,
and classic views of the city.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)
- [Dave] If you really want to see
how New Yorkers celebrate Christmas,
head out to Dyker Heights in Brooklyn.

Now this neighborhood
takes holiday lighting
to the extreme,

with houses and yards covered
with lights and decorations
along Dyker Heights Boulevard.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)

New York is an amazing place
to visit anytime of the year.
There are so many things to see and do,
we go back again and again,
and still discover new attractions.

But nothing really compares
to New York at Christmas.

It's the most exciting place
on Earth for the holidays.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)
If you enjoyed our video,
make sure to subscribe to our channel,
and click on that bell for notifications.
We put up new travel videos each week,
so you don't wanna miss out.
(lively sleigh bell music continues)
(lively sleigh bell music fades)
